source_id: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_016_chunk1
evidence_span: Uniaxial tension creep tests have been conducted on polycrystalline alpha zirconium from 50 to 850 C

source_id: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_016_chunk1
evidence_span: From 50 to 300 C the activation energy for creep was stress-dependent increasing from approximately 30 to 75 kcal/mole when the stress was decreased from 800 to 400 kg/cm²

source_id: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_016_chunk1
evidence_span: Two heat treatments were employed in the study: a 750 C alpha anneal followed by a slow furnace cool, which resulted in a 0.03-mm grain intercept
process_step: 750 C alpha anneal + slow furnace cool

source_id: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_016_chunk1
evidence_span: a 1100 C beta anneal followed by a slow furnace cool, which resulted in a 0.7-nm grain intercept
process_step: 1100 C beta anneal + slow furnace cool
